alert.note: Alert for Cass; Crawford (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 5:25AM CST until January 15 at 6:00AM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Winter Storm Continues Early this Morning... .Snow will continue to slide southward this morning, largely exiting the state by sunrise. Breezy winds will continue to cause periods of blowing and drifting snow after snow subsides, but too will subside as the morning progresses. Travel will remain hazardous at times, due to the blowing and drifting snow and snow covered and icy roadways. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Parts of west central Iowa. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and drifting on roadways. The hazardous conditions and poor roads may impact travel into the morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 5 1 1 app or dial 5 1 1.
